name: places/ChIJjUw7LxJawokR2BbkPxWQGQQ
formattedAddress: 1 State St 30th floor, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 State St 30th floor, New York, NY 10004, USA

originalText.text: I absolutely dread dealing with these people but I am stuck. My deceased brother owned shares controlled by Continental and I need basic information to administer his estate. Continental employees lack basic work ethics like returning phone calls and email. They also seem ignorant of their own processes. Their website has a place to register for an account so a shareholder can  gather some information without having to call. However, to create an account you need a shareholder number and not one of them, going back months, has ever been able to tell me what the shareholder number is for this account. Every time I manage to talk to one, after numerous hangups, leaving messages, etc, they say I have to fill out another form. I have sent then countless forms, court documents, certified mail, stamped and notarized statements, and signed letters. Although USPS said they delivered certified mail, they denied getting it.  The only expertise they have is transferring clients to people that don't exist. I mean transfers to numbers where you can't even leave a message. Yep, at that they are the best.

originalText.text: Continental is probably the most incompetent company I've ever dealt with.  My company gave them a simple task of sending out about fifty checks to various stock holders.  We gave them the correct address.  But instead of using those addresses the used an address list from two years back which was out of date.  When we told them about the error they would not cancel the checks sent to the old addresses and send new ones.  Instead they required each shareholder to submit an address change form even though we had already given them the correct addresses.  Do Not Use this company!!  They seem to enjoy being incompetent.

originalText.text: In my career I have used transfer agents more than once when running an M&A or other transaction.  Never used Continental.  Now that I am on the receiving end, trying to get them to transfer shares to my own brokerage account, I can say I never imagined one could be so bad.  Information arriving out of order, incompetent representatives on the phone and no secure way other than snail mail to provide sensitive information like a Form W-9.  Beyond the pale, this is the worst I've ever seen.

originalText.text:
Continental is singularly the worst company and least trustworthy organization in finance. If your shares end up with them for any reason - be wary of what will be a terrible experience. Even after everything was set and the GC of a publicly traded company reached out to admonish them for losing / disregarding legal paperwork, I still don’t have my shares.

The complaints above have also been logged with the better business bureau
And there is ample press on how Continental’s broken processes has contributed to losses for retail investors many times.

I wish I had known…If you are a decision maker or close to one at a major firm, do whatever you can to avoid them selecting Continental.

PS they will probably put an innocuous “someone will reach out”. My last email was opened 30+ times internally and no one has reached out yet. It is shameful.

originalText.text:
I have held an account with continental for years and it has made my life much harder. Their customer service representatives are so rude that and unhelpful that talking to them to figure out how to close an account is excruciating. Today, I finally got the information I needed to close my account with continental, and I can't be more excited. Getting the information was excruciating, and the representative on the phone was extremely rude. I never write reviews, but this experience was so exceptionally horrible, that I had to leave one. I can't believe this company is still around if they treat their customers like this. Also, online it says to call their number because they have award winning customer service. When you call the line, an automated message states that they are overwhelmed with callers and to hang up and use their online features. Very glad to be discontinuing all business with them.

EDIT ADDED 2/18/22:
Please note that the company responded to the google review telling me to contact them about the issue. I tried contacting them via email, phone, and directly through their website and STILL have received no response. I truly do not understand how this company is so horrible at responding to their own customers anywhere except for Google. This is likely due to the fact that they only care about what new customers might think, and are completely uninterested in helping their current clients. I HIGHLY RECCOMMEND SWITCHING TO CHARLES SCHWAB.

EDIT Added 9/13/2022:
Please note that this company responded to my review telling me to contact them and I still have not bee able to get through to anyone about these issues.
